description: Variant of miserable +â€Ž -ist, with interconsonant -i- added due to difficulty or lack of flow in pronouncing miserablist.

adjectives.description: miserabilist (comparative more miserabilist, superlative most miserabilist)

entries.meaning: One who is unhappy, or extols being miserable as a virtue; a philosopher of pessimism.
examples: Synonyms: buzzkill, killjoy, spoilsport; see also Thesaurus:spoilsport
